poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Keeps a tawse in his inside pocket Toys with it, quick on the draw. That isn't elbow-patch material: More like a boot sole. The B class Toils in delta S for silence. Red-hot tongs, he's thinking, used to shed Dim light on trolls and unter- Menschen in their hemp and leather togs. The saints In trons and dungeons were delivered From this world with such forceps. Such were the martyrs' Terms of reference.
